post.author: Mike
post.title: You Can Use Your Airline Miles To Book Flights For Anyone!
post.content:
Booking free flights is the well-earned outcome of being granted miles from flights for weeks, months, and even years. To a casual flier, free flights are a desirable prize, but for frequent fliers and business travelers, earning free flights and saving miles are inevitable. That usually makes the rewards less valuable or appealing to them.

Nevertheless, there are ways for any type of airline traveler to exchange these rewards. Within the fine line of the terms and conditions of the agreement of airline websites is the declaration that frequent fliers can book flights with Airline Miles for someone else, such as a family member or spouse.

Book Flights with Airline Miles Online 

Most airlines permit a person to book flights with Airline Miles (award flights) online. When booking a flight for someone else, log onto the appropriate account and begin the same award flight booking process. The details of the “Passenger Information” should be that of the guest. Prior to checking out, it is imperative to determine that the passenger’s name will be akin to the name of the beneficiary instead of the primary holder’s name. 

Calling the Airline

Even though a large number of airlines allow people to book flights with Airline Miles via their websites, some airlines would actually prefer that they notify the airline in person over the phone or at any ticketing desks that the airline miles will be utilized by their friends or family members. If there is any problem in changing the details of the passenger directly on the website, rather visit or call the airline to book the flight directly.

Swapping Awards

Occasionally, frequent fliers or business travelers of different loyalty programs swap award flights on the Internet. If a person wants to fly with his award ticket, but not with his own airline, he can try to book flights with Airline Miles for someone else with his award and have her book one for him with her award, for example. 

International Flights

A few airlines require passengers to display the same credit card utilized to book flights with Airline Miles when they check-in for their International flight. Other airlines may simply need a letter of acknowledgement that the passenger used miles from his friend’s account to book the flight. In some cases, a copy of the credit card used is also needed. This copy should be revealed at the checking in desk.  

To book flights with Airline Miles successfully, it is important that a person reads the terms and conditions carefully to avoid any discrepancies.  Search online for more details or call the relevant airline directly if there is anything that is difficult to understand in terms of booking a flight for someone else using airline miles.
